[[Young Knives]] |Off With Their Heads Tour |35,000 |- |3 June 2011 |[[Rod Stewart]] |[[Stevie Nicks]] |[[Heart & Soul Tour]] | |- |} ===Religious events=== In 1985, 15,000 [[Jehovah's Witnesses]] held a three-day [[Convention (meeting)|convention]] at Elland Road stadium.<“Integrity Keepers” District Conventions Programme> Elland Road hosted the annual Jehovah's Witness conventionshttp://footballgroundguide.ipbhost.com/index.php?showtopic=21803 until 2013 when they moved to the new [[First Direct Arena]].{{cite web|title=Thousands set to flock to Leeds arena for major Jehovah's Witnesses convention|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/news/latest-news/top-stories/thousands-set-to-flock-to-leeds-arena-for-major-jehovah-s-witnesses-convention-1-5816826 |work=Yorkshire Evening Post|accessdate=3 July 2013}} ==Transport== The nearest railway station is [[Cottingley railway station|Cottingley]], although fans travelling will be more likely to arrive at [[Leeds railway station|Leeds Station]], which is approximately {{convert|1.5|mi|km}} from the stadium.{{cite web|url=http://www.wafll.com/elland-road/elland-road-directions.html|title=Elland Road – Details for Visitors |accessdate=3 April 2008 |publisher=wafll.com}} This is around a 35-minute walk, but taxis and buses run from outside the station to the ground. Visitors travelling by car can park in the ground's nearby car parks or make use of limited space in surrounding streets. On match days there are special bus services direct to and from the stadium, usually departing from Sovereign Street near Leeds Station as well as regular local bus services. Leeds City Council have raised plans for a railway station on the [[Wakefield Line]] serving Elland Road but there are no time frames since capacity issues on the Wakefield Line and funding for a new station would need addressing. ==Attendance== ===Leeds City=== In Leeds City's brief history, attendances were among the worst in the league. The club competed in the league for 15 years, from the [[1905–06 in English football|1905–06 season]] until its expulsion in the [[1919–20 in English football|1919–20 season]]. The club was poorly financed throughout that period. Association football was a new concept in the area, which as traditionally a rugby league region. Nonetheless, the club were, until the 2009 relegation of Luton Town, the highest-placed team not currently in the league in the all-time average attendance figures for the [[The Football League|Football League]] and [[Premier League]]. In total, 1,944,365 people attended Elland Road for all the matches played by the club, giving an average figure of 10,234.{{cite web |url=http://www.nufc.com/html/attendance-all-time.html |title=All Time League Attendance Records |work=Niall Mackenzie |accessdate=3 April 2008 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080309122725/http://www.nufc.com/html/attendance-all-time.html| archivedate = 9 March 2008}} ===Leeds United=== Leeds United was formed shortly after City's dissolution and entered the league in the [[1920–21 in English football|1920–21 season]]. By this time, football had established itself and in its first season, the average attendance was over 16,000. As of the [[2005–06 in English football|2005–06 season]], 42,339,944 have attended all of Leeds United's matches combined, which gives an average of 25,689. This figure is the 10th highest average in England. Antofagasta|website= El Nortero|date=July 21, 2012|access-date=December 17, 2016}} | website = [http://www.municipalidadantofagasta.cl Municipality of Antofagasta website] {{Unbulleted Sudamericana|Copa Sudamericana 2013]] |[[2015 Copa América|Copa América 2015]] }} | construction_cost = {{unbulleted list |[[United States dollar|US$]] 13,062,290 |[[Chilean peso|CLP]] 8,800,000,000 |[[Euro|EU€]] 12,498,000. }} | architect = {{unbulleted list |'''Original:''' |Mario Recordón{{cite web |url=http://www.correa3.com/pdf/CiudadDeportivaAntofagasta.pdf|title= Ciudad Deportiva de Antofagasta Etapa II diagnostico|website= Correa 3 Arquitectos|language=Spanish| date= 2013 |access-date=December 17, 2016}} ---- |'''Remodelation:''' |Valle & Cornejo Arquitectos |Nicolás Lipthay (Collaboration Associated) }} | general_contractor = {{unbulleted list |'''Construction:''' |Constructora Wadeless Balmaceda Mathiew y Cia. (1961 Construction) |Empresa Constructora e Industrial Jorge Razmilic y Cia. (1962 Continued Construction){{cite web |url=http://www.descubrechile.cl/region/antofagasta/antofagasta/estadio_regional_de_antofagasta/index.html|title= Información de Estadio Regional de Antofagasta:|website= Descubre Chile|language=Spanish|access-date=December 17, 2016}} ---- |'''Remodelation:''' |Navarrete y Díaz Cumsille Ingenieros Civiles S.A. (Remodeling){{cite web |url=http://www.mivozregional.cl/noticia/deporte/intendente-y-remodelacion-del-estadio-regional-de-antofagasta-no-podemos-entregar-la|title=Intendente y Remodelación del Estadio Regional de Antofagasta: "No podemos entregar las obras por negligencia del municipio"|website= Mi Voz Regional|language=Spanish|date=November 15, 2012|access-date=December 16, 2016}} }} | main_contractors = {{unbulleted list |Sociedad Comercial Wu y Pazzanese Limitada (LED Screens Installation) |Led Neón Chile Vía Pública Ltda.(acquisition and Installation of seatings){{cite web |url=http://www.region2.cl/aprueban-contrato-para-instalacion-de-butacas-en-el-estadio-regional/|title=Aprueban Contrato para Instalación de Butacas en el Estadio Regional|website= Region2.cl|language=Spanish| date=June 21, 2012 |access-date=September 18, 2016}} |[[Philips|Philips Chile]] (Lighting fixtures){{cite web |url=http://www.mindep.cl/regional-de-antofagasta-con-iluminacion-de-lujo-para-copa-america/|title=Regional de Antofagasta con iluminación de lujo para Copa América|website= Ministerio del Deporte Chile|language=Spanish|access-date=September 18, 2016}} |Parques Johnson Construcciones deportivas y Áreas Verdes (Delivery Seed of Ryegrass and Bermuda to No. 1 Field) |Milton Astudillo Capetillo (Delivery Seed of to 2, 3 and 4 Fields){{cite web |url=http://www.macservicios.cl/detalle.php?id=11|title=Copa América 2015: a fin de mes comenzará la construcción de las cuatro canchas de pasto natural en Antofagasta|website= Ministerio del Deporte Chile|language=Spanish|access-date=May 28, 2017}} }} | project_manager = {{unbulleted list |'''Original:''' |Municipality of Antofagasta ---- |'''Remodelation:''' |Instituto Nacional del Deporte |[[Minera Escondida]] |Municipality of antofagasta }} | structural engineer = Santolaya Ingenieros Consultores S.A. (Remodeling) | fullname = Estadio Regional Bicentenario Calvo y Bascuñán de Antofagasta | former_names = Estadio Regional de Antofagasta(1964–2010){{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20100213/pags/20100213000503.html|title=Estadio se llamará "Calvo y Bascuñán" |website= El Mercurio de Antofagasta |language=Spanish|date=February 13, 2010|access-date=December 17, 2016}} | tenants = '''Football:'''
[[Club de Deportes Antofagasta]] (CDA) (1966–present)
Club deportivo Ormazabal (2006–present)
Club Deportivo Unión Bellavista (1964–1966, 2008–present) ---- '''Baseball:'''
Asociación de Béisbol de Antofagasta (1966–present) | seating_capacity = 35,000 spectators (initial construction)
21,178 seatings (after renovation){{cite web |url=http://elportalceleste.pe/estadios-modernos-con-capacidad-para-25-000-personas/|title=Estadios modernos con capacidad para 25 000 personas|website= El Portal Celeste|language=Spanish| first=Henry|last=Samadiego |access-date=September 18, 2016}} | suites = 36{{cite web |url=http://www.soychile.cl/Antofagasta/Deportes/2012/06/21/100014/Municipio-entregara-803-millones-para-la-instalacion-de-butacas-en-el-Estadio-Regional-de-Antofagasta.aspx|title=Municipio entregará 803 millones para la instalación de butacas en el Estadio Regional de Antofagasta|website= SoyChile.cl|language=Spanish| date=June 21, 2014 |access-date=December 17, 2016}} | record_attendance = {{formatnum: 32.000}} (Unión Bellavista – Universidad Católica, 4 October 1964 )
(Chile – Perú, 28 April 2004) | dimensions = {{convert|106|x|68|m|abbr=on}}{{cite web |url=http://www.elgraficochile.cl/radiografia-a-los-estadios-como-estan-nuestros-recintos-para-un/prontus_elgrafico/2014-11-03/181104.html |title=Radiografía a los estadios: ¿Cómo están nuestros recintos para un posible Mundial 2030?|website=El Grafico Chile|first=Pablo|last=Serey|access-date=December 16, 2016}} | field_shape = Rectangular | acreage = {{unbulleted list |{{convert|7280|m2|abbr=on}} (building){{cite web |url=http://www.dipres.gob.cl/595/articles-114811_doc_pdf.pdf |title=Balance de Gestión Integral Año 2013|website=Dirección de Arquitectura|access-date=December 17, 2016}} |{{convert|30000|m2|abbr=on}} (total property) }} }} '''Estadio Regional de Antofagasta''', officially '''Estadio Bicentenario Calvo y Bascuñan de Antofagasta''', ([[Spanish language|Spanish]]: {{IPA-es|esˈtaðjo βiθenteˈnaɾjo ˈkalβo yi βasˈkuɲan|}}) is a [[Sports complex|sport facilities complex]] located in [[Antofagasta]], Chile. The municipality of Antofagasta is the owner of the building and its used to host sports events such as cultural events and entertainment events. The complex is composed of the Main Stadium who is use made for most important events. The secondary fields, 1, 2, 3 and 4, are used to training sessions. The Field 5 is used to secondary events, with football pitch dimensions and counts with a Baseball field where are made the regional tournaments of this sport. It is currently the home stadium of Football Team of the city, [[Club de Deportes Antofagasta]], of [[Chilean Primera División]]. The [[Chile national football team]] plays for first time in this stadium on April 28, 2004, in a friendly match with the [[Perú national football team|Perú]]. With an attendance of 32.000 spectators. The Complex was built in 1964 by the Municipality of Antofagasta and supported by the Regional Stadium Construction Committee (Comité Pro Construcción Estadio Regional) the main stadium of this complex had an initial capacity of 35.000 spectators, after de renovation, In 2011 started the renovation of the stadium changed the maximum of capacity to 21,178 spectators since in 2013. In February 2010, by requests from the community of Antofagasta that began in 2003, the mayor of the city called to the community to send names to name the stadium through popular votation to elect this. The winning the name was "Estadio Calvo y Bascuñan". The stadium has been a venue for the [[1987 FIFA World Youth Championship]], [[2013 Supercopa de Chile]], [[2013 Copa Sudamericana|Copa Sudamericana 2013]] and [[2015 Copa América|Copa América 2015]]. ==History== ===Development and construction=== A city stadium was considered in 1955, with the intention that it could function as host for the [[1962 FIFA World Cup]] in Chile. The initiative was led by two professionals from Antofagasta, Miguel Bascuñán Pavez and Alberto Calvo Nieto, who formed the "Pro-Construction Committee" in 1958 with the aim of solidifying the project. It was decreed by law (13,080 from the Ministry of the Interior of Chile) that the lands then-occupied by the Club Hípico de Antofagasta (Riding Club of Antofagasta) be expropriated to the municipality for the construction of the stadium, stipulating the amount to be paid, the agreement being effective on January 31, 1959.{{cite web |url=http://www.leychile.cl/Navegar?idNorma=27357|title=Autoriza a La Municipalidad de Antofagasta Para Expropiar El Terreno Que Indica y Cuyos Señala, De Propiedad Del Club Hípico de Antofagasta, Con El Fin de Destinarlo a La Construcción Del Estadio Regional De Esa Ciudad, Autoriza Al Presidente de la Republica Para Donar al Club Hípico de Antofagasta Los Terrenos Fiscales Que Indica y Cuyos Deslindes Señala, Ubicados en la Localidad de la Chimba, y Que Han Sido Entregados en Arrendamiento a Dicha Institución, Con el Fin de Destinarlos a la Construcción del Nuevo Hipodromo, Lo Autoriza, Ademas, Para Ceder a la Municipalidad de Antofagasta los terrenos Que Individiualiza, Ubicados en Esa Comuna, Y Ocupados Por El Estadio Municipal, Corporación Que Podra Enajenarlos Para Invertir Su Producto en Obras de Adelanto Local|website= Ley Chile|language=Spanish| date=November 5, 1958 |access-date=December 17, 2016}} The amount decreed was 300 million [[Chilean Peso|CLP]]. The [[1960 Valdivia earthquake]] caused severe damage to several stadiums in Chile, upsetting the calendar for the World Cup. On September 30, 1960, the Corporation of Development of Chile (Corfo) provided economic contributions toward the construction of the Antofagasta stadium, under the condition that work began before March 1, 1961. Mayor Santiago Gajardo handed over the land to the Santiago-based Wedeles, Balmaceda, Mathieu and Company, Ltd. on January 5, 1961. The work officially began on January 18.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20071217/pags/20071217000514.html|title=Comienza la construcción|website= El Mercurio de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=December 17, 2007|access-date=December 16, 2016}} However, due to financial problems, construction was postponed and the committee responsible was dissolved. Work resumed on July 3, 1961 with the demolition of the riding club's facilities. Calvo and Bascuñan reformed the construction committee and secured government and private funding, though they'd lost the opportunity to host the 1962 World Cup. On July 9, 1962, Razmilic and Co. restarted the unfinished work. ===Inauguration=== On October 8, 1964, the stadium was inaugurated before President Jorge Alessandri, Mayor Juan Floreal Recabarren and his predecessor Santiago Gajardo. Trading markets in the city closed that day at noon, with a request that private companies enable their workers to attend the event. Approximately 32,000 people came. The stadium was then the second largest in the country. The match of the event was between Unión Bellavista (local team) and [[Club Deportivo Universidad Católica]].{{cite web |url=http://www.conmebol.com/en/content/regional-stadium-antofagasta-venue-2015-copa-america-chile|title=Regional Stadium of Antofagasta, venue for the 2015 Copa América in Chile|website= Conmebol.com|date=October 18, 2014|access-date=December 17, 2016}} On October 12, a game was played between the teams of the city of Asociación de Fútbol de Antofagasta and Chuquicamata, which was attended by approximately 16,000 spectators. The result of the match was 4–2 for Antofagasta, the coach of the team of Antofagasta was [[Luis Santibáñez|Luis Santibañez Diaz]].{{cite web |url=http://www.estrellaantofagasta.cl/prontus4_nots/site/artic/20110627/pags/20110627001240.html|title=eSTADIO rEGIONAL DIJO "ADIÓS" COMO GANADOR|website= Estrella de Antofagasta|date=June 27, 2011|access-date=August 13, 2017}} {{Quote |quote = The stadiums are schools, Because there the youth is educated in the physical, muscular and this, once achieved, reports immense benefits for the family and community: To make stadiums is to make homeland. |author = Mario Recordón |source = ''100 Obras, 200 Años; Legado Bicentenario'' cited from stadium inauguration in 1964 }} On July 7, 1965, the construction committee was dissolved and another association formed to complete the lighting of the stadium. Chile Exploration Company donated US$100,000 to finance this project. ===Notable events, 1967–2008=== In February 1967, a youth football championship was held, in which one of the finalists was the Iquique team.{{cite web |url=http://www.estrellaarica.cl/prontus4_nots/site/artic/20060511/pags/20060511113459.html|title=Dos vidas en Arica y Sao Paulo|language=Spanish|website= Estrella de Arica|first=Amadiel René|last=Nuñez Salcedo|date=May 11, 2006|access-date=December 18, 2016}} In July 22, 1973 the highest ever attendance was recorded, when 32,663 people watched the [[Chilean Primera División|Primera Division]] match between [[Deportes Antofagasta|Antofagasta]] and [[Colo-Colo]]. In October 1987, the stadium was a host for the [[1987 FIFA World Youth Championship]], where the national teams of [[Germany national youth football team|West Germany]], [[Bulgaria national football team|Bulgaria]], [[United States men's national under-20 soccer team|United States]] and [[Saudi Arabia national under-20 football team|Saudi Arabia]], all of Group D, played 6 games. The stadium also hosted the quarter-final match between West Germany and [[Scotland national under-20 football team|Scotland]]. The average audience attendance was 8,417. A large investment had to be made for the stadium to host the event, with improvements to field number 5, the stands and scoreboard.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20060916/pags/20060916013920.html|title=Antofagasta recibirá mundial femenino sub 20|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=September 16, 2006|access-date=December 18, 2016}} In 1996, the six-lane athletic track was installed. On the same year. The first game registered by Club de Deportes Antofagasta Portuario, valid for national tournaments, exercising of local, was in the encounter between Club Lister Rossel de Linares and Portuario, beating to this first one by 2–1.{{cite web |url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablesc/chile66.html|title=Chile 1966|website= .rsssf.com|access-date=December 17, 2016}} In 2001, an audit was carried out which established the embezzlement of funds and corruption of a public instrument by a municipal official. It was reported that Mayor Pedro Araya filed a federal court complaint regarding this event.{{cite web |url=https://www.cooperativa.cl/noticias/pais/a-la-justicia-denunciaron-irregularidades-en-estadio-regional-de-antofagasta/2002-10-09/172900.html|title=A la justicia denunciaron irregularidades en Estadio Regional de Antofagasta|website= Cooperativa.cl|language=Spanish|date=October 9, 2002|access-date=December 18, 2016}} On September 20, 2013, the final of the National Children's Baseball tournament was played at the stadium's baseball field, in which Antofagasta and Iquique met.{{cite web |url=http://www.estrellaantofagasta.cl/site/edic/20030920010457/pags/20030920015444.html|title=Antofagasta e Iquique toman el bate y van al "cajón"|website= Estrella de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=September 20, 2003|access-date=December 18, 2016}} In April 2014, a friendly match was proposed between the national teams of Chile and Peru, for which the mayor of Antofagasta promised to improve the state of the field.{{cite web |url=https://www.cooperativa.cl/noticias/deportes/futbol/seleccion-chilena/amistoso-entre-chile-y-peru-no-se-mueve-de-antofagasta/2004-04-15/150239.html|title=Amistoso entre Chile y Perú no se mueve de Antofagasta|website= Cooperativa.cl|language=Spanish|date=April 15, 2003|access-date=December 18, 2016}} The manager of Peru's team decided not to train in the stadium, alluding to security problems and a need to practice without spectators.{{cite web |url=https://www.cooperativa.cl/noticias/deportes/brasil-2014/clasificatorias-sudamerica/peru-se-nego-a-entrenar-en-el-regional-de-antofagasta/2004-04-27/212823.html|title=Perú se negó a entrenar en el Regional de Antofagasta|website= Cooperativa.cl|language=Spanish|date=April 27, 2003|access-date=December 18, 2016}} The match was held on April 28, resulting in a tie, with an attendance of 32,000.{{cite web |url=http://www.11v11.com/matches/chile-v-peru-28-april-2004-253301/|title=Chile v Peru, 28 April 2004|website= 11v11.com|language=Spanish|access-date=December 18, 2016}} In 2005, a friendly match was held between the teams of River Plate U-23 and the Chilean U-20 team, with the aim of preparing the national team for the World Cup in Holland.{{cite web |url=https://www.cooperativa.cl/noticias/deportes/futbol/sub-20/la-sub-20-de-chile-encontro-un-obstaculo-insalvable-en-river-plate/2005-05-05/001058.html|title=La sub 20 de Chile encontró un obstáculo insalvable en River Plate|website=Cooperativa.cl|language=Spanish|date= May 5, 2005|access-date=December 18, 2016}} In 2006, [[Club de Deportes Antofagasta]] (CDA) acquired 650 seats from Brazil, with an investment of 8,000,000 CLP, installed in the stadium's preferred sector, for the anniversary of the city and the return to Premiere A series football. In addition to these improvements, the Regional Intendant asked that the stadium be provided with a synthetic track, in order to improve athletic practices.{{cite web |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2006/01/14/207889/deportes-antofagasta-remodela-su-estadio-para-jugar-en-primera-a.html|title=Deportes Antofagasta remodela su estadio para jugar en Primera A|website=El Mercurio Online|language=Spanish|date=January 14, 2006|access-date=December 18, 2016}} The remodeling of the athletic track increased the number of lanes from 6 to 8, using the synthetic material Repugol AF. It cost 816.212.000 CLP, financed by the Municipality of Antofagasta, the regional council and Chiledeportes (a national program to promote sport activities). The CDA team had to move to other venues during the construction.{{cite web |url=https://www.cooperativa.cl/noticias/deportes/futbol/antofagasta/antofagasta-inauguro-la-polemica-pista-atletica-del-estadio-regional/2007-12-06/133059.html|title=Antofagasta inauguró la polémica pista atlética del Estadio Regional|website=Cooperativa.cl|language=Spanish|date=December 6, 2007|access-date=December 18, 2016}} Chiledeportes promised a US$3 million investment to five Chilean stadiums, including that of Antofagasta, for the [[2008 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup]]. Former Secretary General of [[CONCACAF]] (Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football), Chuck Blazer, inspected the stadium and found that it was not fit to host matches of the competition. He recommended improvements to be made within 60 days to meet FIFA requirements.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20070227/pags/20070227015247.html|title=Peligra Antofagasta como sede del Mundial Femenino|website=El Mercurio de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=February 27, 2007|access-date=December 18, 2016}} The bathrooms were closed by the Ministry of Health of Antofagasta due to the low quality of hygiene.{{cite web |url=http://www.t13.cl/noticia/deportes/copa-america-2015-los-millonarios-montos-sede-por-sede|title=Copa América 2015: Los millonarios montos sede por sede|website=T13.cl|language=Spanish|date=November 17, 2014|access-date=December 18, 2016}} ===Remodeling and renaming=== On January 22, 2009, the stadium was among 15 venues chosen for a remodeling in the second phase of the national program Red de Estadios Bicentenario (Bicentennial Stadium Network) and was installed the synthetic grass on the field 5. The opening match for this setting was between Club de Deportes Antofagasta and Municipal Mejillones on U-15 category, the result of the match was 1-0, won Antofagasta.{{cite web |url=https://www.cooperativa.cl/noticias/deportes/gobierno/ind/bachelet-presento-la-segunda-fase-de-la-red-de-estadios-bicentenario/2009-01-22/113814.html|title=Bachelet presentó la segunda fase de la Red de Estadios Bicentenario|website=Cooperativa.cl|language=Spanish|date=January 22, 2009|access-date=December 18, 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20090122/pags/20090122000507.html|title=Brillante inauguración de la cancha 5 del Regional|website=Mercurio de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=January 22, 2009|access-date=August 13, 2017}} Minera Escondida, the first private company to invest in the program, committed US$8.8 million for the remodeling of the stadium. This was added to contributions of the regional government, Chiledeportes and Ministry of Public Works. The remodel would include a modern electronic scoreboard, perimeter lighting, dressing rooms, massage rooms, a preparatory area for referees, and parking and recreation areas.{{cite web |url=http://www.latercera.com/noticia/antofagasta-anuncia-moderno-estadio-de-8-800-millones/|title= Antofagasta anuncia moderno estadio de $8.800 millones|website=Latercera.com|language=Spanish|date=September 4, 2009|access-date=December 18, 2016}} An agreement between Minera Escondida and the respective public organizations was to open bidding in August, with works to begin in November 2010.{{cite web |url=http://www.estrellaantofagasta.cl/prontus4_nots/site/artic/20090728/pags/20090728001358.html|title= El 2010 estará listo el Regional|website=La estrella de antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=July 28, 2009|access-date=December 19, 2016}} Former mayor Pedro Araya and a group from the sports community sought to rename the stadium "Calvo Bascuñan", in tribute to the promoters of its original construction. The municipality opened a process to consider this and other suggestions from the citizens. On February 13, 2010, the evaluation committee reported that the stadium would be renamed Calvo y Bascuñan (Calvo and Bascuñan). The Municipal Council processed the remodeling of the stadium in May 2010, by means of an extraordinary section needed to regularize the agreement – as Minera Escondida was a private entity and the project was a public work. It was assigned to the municipality through the Corporación Municipal de Deportes.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/admin/render/noticia/23176|title= Concejo Municipal de Antofagasta aprobó modificaciones a acuerdo para construir Estadio Regional|website=Elnortero.cl|language=Spanish|date=May 27, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}} [[File:Antofagasta - Estadio Regional (5204148710).jpg|thumb|left|Photography of the stadium in 2010, before the remodel.]] Due to the [[2010 Chile earthquake]] which occurred on February 27, the government reallocated the committed money for the stadium to the disaster area, to the annoyance of former-mayor Marcela Hernando.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/admin/render/noticia/23197|title= Nuevo Estadio Regional para Antofagasta: Gobierno quita financiamiento y proyecto se esfuma|website=Elnortero.cl|language=Spanish|date=May 29, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}} On June 2, the former mayor received a commitment from the National Sports Institute, which would deliver 62.5% of their promised funding in 2011 and 32.5% in 2012.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/admin/render/noticia/23231|title= Fin de la Teleserie: Chiledeportes corrige oficio y confirma platas para el Estadio Regional|website=Elnortero.cl|language=Spanish|date=June 2, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}} The former Secretary of Sports, Gabriel Ruiz-table, visited the stadium with the mayor, assuring that there would be resources for the remodeling so that the venue could be used for other events in addition to football matches.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/admin/render/noticia/23291|title= Subsecretario de Deportes recorrió Estadio Regional y aseguró que habrá recursos para remodelación|website=Elnortero.cl|language=Spanish|date=June 8, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}} Bidding proposals were opened on June 7, 2010. The only presentation was from the company Salfa SA, which proposed either following the established model or its own draft, either of which exceeded the established budget for the project.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/admin/render/noticia/23285|title= Sólo una empresa interesada en construir nuevo Estadio Regional de Antofagasta|website=Elnortero.cl|language=Spanish|date=June 8, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}} On June 21, the economic proposal was opened, and a second call for tenders was made on November 20.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/admin/render/noticia/23410|title= Remodelación Estadio Regional de Antofagasta: Constructora presenta propuesta por 13 mil millones|website=Elnortero.cl|language=Spanish|date=June 22, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/admin/render/noticia/24827|title= Nueva licitación para construcción de Estadio Regional se iniciaría el 20 de noviembre|website=Elnortero.cl|language=Spanish|date=November 8, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}} In October the Municipality of Antofagasta asked for support from the Chilean National Football Association (ANFP) with the purpose of getting more financial resources to make the remodelation. This action results in an agreement between the association and the municipality.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20101021/pags/20101021211542.html|title= Municipio logra apoyo de la ANFP para nuevo estadio|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=October 21, 2010|access-date= August 13, 2017}} Interest was expressed by 21 companies, and at that time it was expected that work could begin in May 2012.{{cite web |url=http://www.estrellaantofagasta.cl/prontus4_nots/site/artic/20101215/pags/20101215162955.html|title= 21 empresas están interesadas en la remodelación del Estadio Regional de Antofagasta|website=La Estrella de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=December 15, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}} In 2011, the opening for technical proposals was presented.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20110330/pags/20110330000510.html|title= Abren propuestas técnicas por licitación del Regional|website=El Mercurio de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=March 30, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}} It was stipulated that the opening period would be in July.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20110401/pags/20110401000522.html|title= "Tendremos estadio y torneos de lujo"website=El Mercurio de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=April 1, 2010|access-date=December 19, 2016}} The winning proposal was from Valle & Cornejo Arquitectos, with contributions of L2C and architect Nicolás Lipthay.{{cite web |url=http://www.plataformaarquitectura.cl/cl/02-94545/propuesta-ganadora-normalizacion-estadio-regional-de-antofagasta-valle-cornejo-arquitectos-l2c|title=Propuesta Ganadora Normalización Estadio Regional de Antofagasta / Valle & Cornejo Arquitectos + L2C|website=Plataforma Arquitectura|language=Spanish|date=June 22, 2010|last=Portilla|first=Daniel|access-date=December 19, 2016}} On July 28, the works were contracted to the construction company Navarrate Díaz Cumsille and Ingeniería y Construcciones Serinco Ltd., and the main coliseum was closed for a projected term of 360 days. In February 2011, the first Chile national American football team play an exhibition match against a local team called Gladiadores del Desierto, this match was on the 5° Field of the stadium, the result was 26-18, the winner was the Chile national team.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20110227/pags/20110227000558.html|title=Selección chilena de fútbol americano pasó por el Regional|website=Mecurio de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=February 27, 2011|access-date=August 12, 2017}} In July 2011, was begun makes the removal of tons of debris to begin the realization of the major works to renovate the stadium.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20110630/pags/20110630000506.html|title=Sacan toneladas de material en desuso del Estadio Regional|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=June 11, 2011|access-date=August 13, 2017}} In December 2011, the construction suffered a delay of two months due to problems with the foundations of roof supports.{{cite web |url=http://www.cdf.cl/cdf/site/artic/20111201/pags/20111201172638.html|title=Se confirma retraso en obras del Estadio Regional de Antofagasta|website=CDF.cl|language=Spanish|date=December 1, 2011|access-date=December 19, 2016}} There were additional delays in October 2012 regarding the seating.{{cite web |url=http://www.diarioantofagasta.cl/regional/16391/nuevo-retraso-en-obras-del-estadio-regional-de-antofagasta/|title=Nuevo retraso en obras del Estadio Regional de Antofagasta|website=Diario Antofagasta|language=Spanish|date=October 26, 2012|last=Araya Molinari|first=Javier|access-date=December 19, 2016}} In December 2012, Antofagasta was officially declared as one of the cities to host the [[2015 Copa América]].{{cite web |url=http://deportes.terra.cl/futbol/anfp-oficializa-sedes-para-copa-america-y-el-mundial-sub-17,58bfaef65799b310VgnCLD2000000dc6eb0aRCRD.html#tarticle|title=ANFP oficializa sedes para Copa América y el Mundial Sub 17|website=deportes.terra.cl|language=Spanish|date=December 15, 2012|access-date=December 19, 2016}} [[File:20-03-2013_Inauguración_Estadio_Regional_Calvo_y_Bascuñán_de_Antofagasta_(8575898834).jpg#/media/File:20-03-2013_Inauguraci%C3%B3n_Estadio_Regional_Calvo_y_Bascu%C3%B1%C3%A1n_de_Antofagasta_(8575898834).jpg|thumb|Left|Former president Sebastián Piñera Echenique, cutting the tape to inaugurate the remodeling of the stadium, March 20, 2016.]] On March 20, 2013, a private inauguration ceremony was held. Former-president Sebastián Piñera cut the tape as part of the protocol.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/noticia/deporte/estadio-vacio-se-inauguro-el-calvo-y-bascunan-de-antofagasta|title=A estadio vacío se inauguró el Calvo y Bascuñán de Antofagasta|website=El nortero|language=Spanish|date=March 20, 2013|last=Molina|first=Diana|access-date=December 19, 2016}} The public ceremony began with a performance of the city's philharmonic orchestra, followed by a match between CDA and América de Cali. The musical group Garras de Amor performed prior to the party of Colo-Colo and Universidad Católica. There was public criticism for the high price of the tickets to the opening party, and a group of councilors argued that the inaugurations of public places should be free as special moments for the city.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/noticia/sociedad/molestia-por-alto-precio-de-entradas-para-inauguracion-de-estadio-regional-de-antof|title=Molestia por alto precio de entradas para inauguración de Estadio Regional de Antofagasta|website=El nortero|language=Spanish|date=March 14, 2013|access-date=December 19, 2016}} The inauguration was concluded by the percussion of the team of América de Cali, which was delayed in arriving to the city.{{cite web |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2013/03/20/589498/escandalo-en-inauguracion-de-estadio-en-antofagasta-america-de-cali-no-llego-a-duelo-ante-locales.html|title=Bochorno en reapertura de estadio antofagastino: Colombianos llegan tarde|website=El Mercurio Online|language=Spanish|date=March 21, 2013|access-date=December 19, 2016}} ===2013–present=== In November 2014, the stadium was officially declared a host for the Copa America 2015 tournament. Through a draw, Jamaica, Paraguay and Uruguay would compete in the stadium.{{cite web |url=http://www.soychile.cl/Antofagasta/Deportes/2014/11/24/289258/Antofagasta-recibira-a-Uruguay-Paraguay-y-Jamaica-en-la-Copa-America-2015.aspx|title=Antofagasta recibirá a Uruguay, Paraguay y Jamaica en la Copa América 2015|website=Soychile.cl|language=Spanish|date=November 24, 2014|access-date=December 20, 2016}} In December the director of the event confirmed to Antofagasta that its stadium was well-liked by the Jamaican National Team, which was competing in the Copa America for the first time. On August 7, 2014, work began to meet the [[Confederación Sudamericana de Fútbol]]'s (CONMEBOL) requirements for the Copa America 2015. The company MAC won the bidding for $4,997,657,850 CLP, delivered by the Fondo Nacional de Desarrollo Regional (Financial instrument){{expand acronym|date=July 2017}} to the municipality, with a term of 5 months.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/noticia/deporte/copa-america-2015-comenzo-construccion-de-canchas-en-el-estadio-regional-de-antofaga|title=Copa América 2015: Comenzó construcción de canchas en el Estadio Regional de Antofagasta|website=El Nortero|language=Spanish|date=August 8, 2014|access-date=December 19, 2016}} On January 27, eight lighting towers and generators were installed for night events on additional courts.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/noticia/deporte/parte-instalacion-de-torres-de-iluminacion-en-canchas-de-estadio-regional|title=Parte Instalación de Torres de Iluminación en Canchas de Estadio Regional|website=El Nortero|language=Spanish|date=January 27, 2015|access-date=December 20, 2016}} ==International events== ===Football=== ====1987 FIFA World Youth Championship==== {{main|1987 FIFA World Youth Championship}} On may 29 of 1987 was the draw of the 1987 FIFA World Youth Championship, In live broadcast from the Hotel Sheraton on Santiago de Chile, in this draw was assigned the teams to the groups, Antofagasta was host of the Group D, conformed with the followings teams: Bulgaria, Saudi Arabia, United States and West Germany.{{cite web|url=http://resources.fifa.com/mm/document/afdeveloping/technicaldevp/50/06/44/u20_chile_1987_en_part1_200.pdf|title=Technical Report Chile 87 (Part 1)|website= FIFA.com |access-date=August 11, 2017}} The first match of the Group was United States against Bulgaria on October 11, both teams used the 4-4-2 system, the result of the match was 0-1 in favor of Bulgaria team, scored by Dimitar Trendafilov on 26 min of the match. The referee was Jean-Fidele Diramba. In the Groups phase of the tournament, the stadium hosted a total of 50.500 spectators, with an average of 8.400. The first day was hosted of 26.000 spectators (matches 4 and 8). The second day hosted 13.000 spectators (Matches 12 and 16). The third day the number of spectators on the matches 20 and 24 was of 11.500 spectators. On Quarter final the stadium was hosted by 4.000 spectators been the last of the 4 venues in this phase.{{cite web|url=http://resources.fifa.com/mm/document/afdeveloping/technicaldevp/50/06/42/u20_chile_1987_en_part2_199.pdf|title=Technical Report Chile 87 (Part 2)|website= FIFA.com |access-date=August 11, 2017}} {{clear}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left; width:100%;" |- !Date !Time ([[Time in Chile|UTC−3]]) !Team No. 1 !Res. !Team No. 2 !Round !Attendance |- |October 11, 1987||17:00||{{fb|USA}} ||style="text-align:center;"|0-1||{{fb|BUL}} ||Group D||style="text-align:center;"|18.000 |- |October 12, 1987||17:00||{{fb|KSA}} ||style="text-align:center;"|0-3||{{fb|FRG}} ||Group D||style="text-align:center;"|8.000 |- |October 14, 1987||17:00||{{fb|USA}} ||style="text-align:center;"|1-0||{{fb|KSA}} ||Group D||style="text-align:center;"|5.000 |- |October 15, 1987||17:00||{{fb|BUL}} ||style="text-align:center;"|0-3||{{fb|FRG}} ||Group D||style="text-align:center;"|8.000 |- |October 17, 1987||17:00||{{fb|USA}} ||style="text-align:center;"|1-2||{{fb|FRG}} ||Group D||style="text-align:center;"|3.500 |- |October 18, 1987||17:00||{{fb|BUL}} ||style="text-align:center;"|2-0||{{fb|KSA}} ||Group D||style="text-align:center;"|8.000 |- |October 21, 1987||16:45||{{fb|FRG}} ||style="text-align:center;"|1-1 (4-3)||{{fb|SCO}} ||Quarter Final||style="text-align:center;"|4.000 |} ====2015 Copa América==== {{main|Copa América 2015}} In 2012, the Municipality of Antofagasta and various institutions announced the nomination of the stadium to be a venue of the events Copa América and Football Youth World Cup in 2015. To meet the required standards, the secondary fields were renovated and seeded with natural grass. Proximity of the airport and medical services were also considered in its selection.{{cite web |url=http://www.elnortero.cl/noticia/deporte/oficializan-postulacion-de-antofagasta-como-sede-de-copa-america-2015|title=Oficializan postulación de Antofagasta como sede de Copa América 2015|website= El Nortero|date=November 26, 2012|access-date=May 28, 2017}} In 2014, CONMEBOL officially chose Antofagasta as one of the eight venues to host the Copa America 2015. Mayor Karen Rojo was charged with improving facilities by the end of the year.{{cite web |url=http://www.region2.cl/conmebol-ratifica-a-antofagasta-como-sede-de-la-copa-america-2015/|title=CONMEBOL Ratifica a Antofagasta Como Sede de la Copa América 2015|website= Region2.cl|date=February 12, 2014|access-date=May 28, 2017}} The event schedule was confirmed in 2014. Chosen by draw, the stadium hosted Jamaica vs. Uruguay on June 13 and Jamaica vs. Paraguay on June 16.{{cite web |url=http://www.latercera.com/noticia/conoce-el-calendario-completo-de-la-copa-america-chile-2015/|author= R.R.|title=Conoce el calendario completo de la Copa América Chile 2015|website= La Tercera|date=November 24, 2014|access-date=June 18, 2017}} These were Jamaica's first appearances in the Copa América.{{cite web |url=https://www.timeline.cl/2014/12/municipio-confirma-que-jamaica-tendra-su-base-en-antofagasta-en-copa-america/|title=Municipio confirma que Jamaica tendrá su base en Antofagasta en Copa América|website=Timeline.cl|language=Spanish|date=December 16, 2014|access-date=December 20, 2016}} Despite being the third-largest of the eight venues the stadium received the lowest attendances of the competition, with 8,653 and 6,009 spectators. Some locals said that the matches which were hosted in Antofagasta were the least attractive of the tournament.{{cite web |url=http://www.latercera.com/noticia/una-copa-con-sabor-dulce/|first=Álvaro|last=Poblete I.|title= Una copa con sabor dulce|website= La Tercera|date=July 5, 2014|access-date=June 18, 2017}} {{clear}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left; width:100%;" |- !Date !Time ([[Time in Chile|UTC−3]]) !Team No. 1 !Res. !Team No. 2 !Round !Attendance |- |June 13, 2015||18:30||{{fb|URU}} ||style="text-align:center;"|[[2015 Copa América Group B#Uruguay vs Jamaica|1–0]]||{{fb|JAM}} ||[[2015 Copa América Group B|Group B]]||style="text-align:center;"|8,653 |- |June 16, 2015||20:30||{{fb|PAR}} ||style="text-align:center;"|[[2015 Copa América Group B#Paraguay vs Jamaica|1–0]]|||{{fb|JAM}} ||[[2015 Copa América Group B|Group B]]||style="text-align:center;"|6,099 |} ===Athletics=== ====Ninth handicapped and blind sportsmans International Tournament==== In July 2005, was organizated the Ninth handicapped and blind sportsmans International Tournament by the Crippled Club of Antofagasta, Nueva Esperanza, the main competitions was made on track field and the grass of the main field. Perú, Bolivia and Chile was the countries who participated in the tournament. With the support of the national army and the municipality of the city. The first places of the tournament in each categories was the following:{{cite web|url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20050716/pags/20050716021842.html|title=Ellos son pura energía en el Estadio Regional|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta | date= July 16, 2005 |access-date=August 13, 2017}} {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} '''Men''' {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="3"|Shot Put |- ! style=|Winner !!| Country |- | Luis Román || {{fb|BOL}} |- | Ricardo González || {{fb|CHI}} |- | Prosperino Zanzana || {{fb|CHI}} |- | Jorge Carrasco || {{fb|CHI}} |- | Sergio Fuentes || {{fb|CHI}} |- ! colspan="3"|500 Meters |- | Carlos Pastén || {{fb|CHI}} |- | Carlos Gallardo || {{fb|CHI}} |- | Dila Martínez || {{fb|BOL}} |- ! colspan="3"|Blinds 100 Meters |- | Max Cordero || {{fb|PER}} |- | Miguel Gómez || {{fb|PER}} |- |} {{col-2}} '''Women''' {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="3"|Shot Put |- ! style=|Winner !!| Country |- | Hermina Olave || {{fb|CHI}} |- | Tabita Parra || {{fb|CHI}} |- | Nayadeth Palma || {{fb|CHI}} |- |} {{col-end}} ==Name== In 2003, the president of the Ciclism association of Antofagasta, René Araya, tried to approach to the Municipality of the city to give a name to the stadium.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20070929/pags/20070929003504.html|title=Alcalde apoya cambio de nombre al Estadio Regional|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta |language=Spanish|date=September 29, 2007|access-date=August 12, 2017}} In July 2006, the former regional delegate of Antofagasta, Manuel Rojas, presented a document to the Municality of Antofagasta, with a proposal to name the stadium "Calvo y Bascuñan", in honor to the main leaders of Comité Pro Construcción Estadio, whom this initiative was possible to build this on 1964.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20070927/pags/20070927000504.html|title=Toma fuerza la idea de cambiar el nombre al Estadio Regional|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta |language=Spanish|date=September 27, 2007|access-date=August 12, 2017}} The former mayor of the city, Daniel Adario, suggested to give a name to the stadium by suffrage. The former President of football association of Chile (ANFP), Harold Mayne-Nicholls, supported the proposal to name the stadium Calvo y Bascuñan.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20071009/pags/20071009000533.html|title=Timonel de ANFP respalda nombre "Calvo Bascuñán"|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta |language=Spanish|date=September 27, 2007|access-date=August 12, 2017}} In October 2007, the councilmen of the municipality on a unanimous decision, approved the project to give to the stadium a name.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20071004/pags/20071004005002.html|title=Unánime respaldo para cambiar nombre al Regional|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta |language=Spanish|date=October 4, 2007|access-date=August 12, 2017}} On 2009, the community of Antofagasta submitted the names to give a name to the stadium through a contest made by the Municipality of the city through a form on web site of this until November 9 of the same year. The names were the following; “Pedro Reyes”, “Guillermo Martin”, “Luis Santibañez”, "Francisco 'Chamaco' Valdés", “Calvo-Bascuñán”, “Sol del Norte”, “Héroes del Pacífico”, “Coloso”, “Riqueza del Desierto”, “Coliseo 14 de Febrero” y “La Portada”.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20091103/pags/20091103145429.html|title="Calvo y Bascuñán" lidera lista de nombres para estadio|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta |language=Spanish|date=November 3, 2007|access-date=August 12, 2017}} In February 13, 2010, the contest to give a name to the stadium finished and the winner proposed name was Calvo y Bascuñan.{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurioantofagasta.cl/prontus4_noticias/site/artic/20100213/pags/20100213000503.html|title=Estadio se llamará "Calvo y Bascuñán"|website= Mercurio de Antofagasta |language=Spanish|date=February 13, 2007|access-date=August 12, 2017}} ==Design== ===Architecture and Infrastructure=== [[File:EstadioCalvoyBascuñanDiagram.png|thumb|Diagram of the Stadium and his seatings]] The stadium's remodel was by architectural company Valle & Cornejo with the collaboration of the architects Nicolás Lipthay, Juan Pablo Duarte, Catalina Donzé, Oscar Conteras and María José Yurisic. The complete area is {{convert|30000|m2|abbr=on}}. The provider was Serge Ferrari. Landscape architecture was by the company Rencoret & Rüttimann Arquitectura del paisaje (Cecilia Rencoret, Carla Rütimann).{{cite web |url=http://www.plataformaarquitectura.cl/cl/02-245794/estadio-regional-antofagasta-valle-cornejo-arquitectos-nicolas-lipthay|title=Estadio Regional de Antofagasta / Valle & Cornejo Arquitectos + Nicolás Lipthay|website= Plataforma Arquitectura |language=Spanish|date=March 22, 2013|access-date=April 28, 2017}} The architects of the remodel describe their work as a search for respect for the urban landmark while seeking a way to unify a design completed by different construction companies. Access of the stadium are organizated from the two squares, organizing circulation through a footbridge. The architectural operation was generated from the desire to make a building with a unique style, through a simple, clean and fancy gesture across the stadium, adding color to the urban environment. The public areas of the enclosure allowed for improved circulation of people. In 2012, two high-definition LED screens were installed, costing 186,830 million CLP. Set in the south and north area of the stadium, the screens measure {{convert|8|x|6|m}}. Between 2014 and 2015, 30 Neighbors of Antofagasta participated in a project to create a mosaic made with rocks, ceramics and seashells in the ends of the stadium walls, for the Copa América 2015.{{cite web |url=http://www.soychile.cl/Antofagasta/Sociedad/2015/02/05/303412/Llamativo-mural-de-mosaico-embellece-el-Estadio-Calvo-y-Bascunan-de-Antofagasta.aspx|title=Llamativo mural de mosaico embellece el Estadio Calvo y Bascuñán de Antofagasta|website= Soyantofagasta |language=Spanish|date=February 2, 2015|access-date=May 15, 2017}} In 2015, lighting was installed on the roof of Tribuna Pacífico, certified by [[Philips]] staff of Chile. The project aimed to achieve a lighting quality of 1200 lux. In the same year, grass was planted in the main field of the stadium. Parques Johnson was the company which completed the work, choosing a mixture of Ryegrass and Bermuda for traction and softness.{{cite web |url=http://www.municipalidaddeantofagasta.cl/index.php/noticias-antofagasta/932-en-tierra-derecha-mejoramiento-de-cancha-n-1-del-estadio-regional?videoid=Rfldh5MU4qc|title= En Tierra Derecha Mejoramiento de Cancha N°1 del Estadio Regional|website= Municipalidad de Antofagasta |language=Spanish|access-date=May 28, 2017}} The second field was finished in June 2015, made of a natural grass, measuring to FIFA standards of {{convert|105|x|68|m}}, with a 24-person dressing room, sanitary facilities, nursing room, eight lighting towers, a 40-person stand and parking facilities.{{cite web |url=http://www.soychile.cl/Antofagasta/Deportes/2015/06/10/327589/Inauguraron-las-canchas-de-entrenamiento-del-Estadio-Calvo-y-Bascunan.aspx|title= Inauguraron las canchas de entrenamiento del Estadio Calvo y Bascuñán|website= SoyAntofagasta |language=Spanish|date= June 10, 2015|access-date=May 28, 2017}} In June 2015, 270 desks for the press were installed in the stadium, with Wi-fi and LAN access. They were installed on Tribuna Pacifico, in time for [[Copa America 2015]]. The monetary investment was 492 million CLP. Also included were six additional press stands.{{cite web |url=http://www.diarioantofagasta.cl/deportes/40747/municipalidad-de-antofagasta-inicia-entrega-de-obras-mayores-del-estadio-calvo-y-bascunan/|title= Municipalidad de Antofagasta inicia entrega de obras mayores del Estadio Calvo y Bascuñan|website= Diario de Antofagasta |language=Spanish|date=June 3, 2015|access-date=May 21, 2017}} ===Materials=== The front of the stadium was designed to endure the climate and urban environment. The materials were chosen to allow easy maintenance. The building has reinforced concrete supports; the concrete terminations have a flat style, and the front slab made with phenolic resin. There is an illumination system in the Area Pacifico. The seats of the stadium are solid, ergonomic and retractable, with colors allusive to the CDA theme. The seats are folding with armrests and cup holders, fulfilling FIFA standards.{{cite web |url=http://www.region2.cl/comenzo-la-instalacion-de-butacas-y-pantallas-led-en-el-estadio-regional/|title= Comenzó la Instalación de Butacas y Pantallas Led en el Estadio Regional|website= Region2.cl |language=Spanish|date=October 26, 2012|access-date=May 15, 2017}} The distribution of the seats is to the VIP and very VIP area (36), Tribuna Pacifico (9,437), Tribuna Andes (5,859), north gallery (2,565) and south gallery (3,281). {{coord|23.670|S|70.405|W|display=title|source:dewiki}} ==Transport and access== [[File:EstadioRegionaAntofagastalMap.svg|thumb|right|A map of the Stadium and surrounding connections]] TransAntofagasta is the main public transport service to reach the stadium this by public bus service, the following lines of this public transport arrives to the stadium:{{cite web |url=http://www.mtt.gob.cl/copaamerica/antofagasta|title=Antofagasta|author=Ministerio de Transportes y Telecomunicaciones|language=Spanish |access-date=August 11, 2017}} [[File:MicrobusAntofagasta.jpg|thumb|right|A TransAntofagasta Bus, Line 114, who arrived to Angamos Ave.]] '''North to South:''' * Linea 102: Normal Travel (Playa Blanca – Galleguillos Lorca street – Homero Ávila street) * Linea 104: Normal Travel ( Ave. Argentina – Nicanor Plaza Street) * Lines 103-107-114- 121: Modificated Travel (Ave. Angamos – Díaz Gana – Galleguillos Lorca – Homero Ávila – Ave. Angamos) * Linea 109: Normal Travel (Ave. Argentina direct to Coviefi street) * Lines 110, 111 y 112: Normal Travel Ave. Argentina direct to Coviefi street * Linea 129: Antonio Poupin – Galleguillos Lorca – Homero Ávila- Ave. Angamos '''South to North''' * Lines 104-129: Normal Travel; Av. Angamos – Homero Ávila – Eduardo Orchard * Lines 102-107: Modificated Travel; Av. Angamos – Homero Ávila – Eduardo Orchard * Lines 103-114- 121: Modificated Travel; (Ave. Angamos – Homero Ávila – Eduardo Orchard – Salvador Reyes – Ave. O’Higgins) * Línea 109, 111 y 112: Normal Travel (Coviefi direct to Ave. Argentina) * Línea 110 : Modificated travel (Coviefi directo a Av. Argentina) ==See also== {{portal|Chile}} *[[List of football stadiums in Chile]] ==References== ===Bibliography=== * {{cite book |last1=Matamala |first1=Daniel |title=Goles y Autogoles: Historia Política del Fútbol Chileno |publisher=Viral Ediciones|year=2015 |location=Chile |isbn=978-956-8992-88-0}} * {{cite magazine |last= Rodriguez Torres |first= Pamela|date= December 16, 2016|title= Mercurio de Antofagasta. 110 Haciendo noticias |magazine= Mercurio de Antofagasta (Special Edition) |location= |publisher= Mercurio de Antofagasta }} * {{cite magazine |last1= Blumel |first1= Gonzalo|last2= Lob |first2= Mauricio|last3= Seebach |first3= Claudio|last4= Piñera |first4= Magdalena|date= December 2013|title= 100 Obras, 200 Años; Legado Bicentenario |url= http://www.sebastianpinera.cl/sites/default/files/legado_bicentenario_copia.pdf |location= Santiago de Chile |isbn= 978-956-7892-35-8 |publisher= Presidencia de la Republica, Gobierno de Chile |access-date= December 17, 2016 }} ===Notes=== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Estadio Regional Calvo y Bascuñán}} * [https://int.soccerway.com/venues/chile/estadio-regional-de-antofagasta/v3377/ Information] at Soccerway * [http://stadiumdb.com/stadiums/chi/estadio_regional_antofagasta Information] at Stadium Database * [http://www.revistaplot.com/es/remodelacion-estadio-regional-de-antofagasta/ Information]{{es icon}} at Revista Plot {{s-start}} {{succession box | title=[[Supercopa de Chile]]

{{Infobox sport governing body |name = Iraq Football Association
الاتحاد العراقي لكرة القدم |abbrev = IFA |logo = Iraqi FA Crest.png |logosize = 200px |sport = [[Association football|Football]]
[[Futsal]]
[[Beach football]] |category = |image = |caption = |jurisdiction = [[Iraq]] |founded = 8 October {{Start date and age|df=yes|1948}} |aff = [[FIFA]] (1950)
[[Asian Football Confederation|AFC]] (1970){{cite web|url=http://eresources.nlb.gov.sg/newspapers/Digitised/Article/straitstimes19701219-1.2.208.aspx|title=Tengku re-elected AFC president|date=19 December 1970|publisher=[[The Straits Times]]|accessdate= }}{{cite web|url=http://eresources.nlb.gov.sg/newspapers/Digitised/Article/beritaharian19710101-1.2.97.aspx|title=Seluroh Asia tetap sokong Sir Stanley|date=1 January 1971|publisher=[[Berita Harian]] (Malay language)|accessdate= }}
[[Union of Arab Football Associations|UAFA]] (1974)
[[West Asian Football Federation|WAFF]] (2000)
[[Arab Gulf Cup Football Federation|AGCFF]] (2016) |region = |regionyear = |headquarters = [[Zayouna]] |location = [[Baghdad]] |president = [[Abdul Khaliq Masood]] |chairman = |chairperson = |chiefexec = |vicepresident = |director = |secretary = |coach = |womenscoach = |key staff = |operating income = |sponsor = |year closed = |replaced = |prevfounded = |url = http://ifa.iq |countryflag = Iraq |countryflag2 = |countryflag3 = |more = }} The '''Iraq Football Association''' ({{lang-ar|الاتحاد العراقي لكرة القدم}}) is the governing body of football in [[Iraq]], controlling the [[Iraq national football team|Iraqi national team]] and the [[Iraq Super League]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/iraq/news/article.cfm?l_id=52&objectid=10759253 |title=Football mad Iraq's new field of dreams - Iraq - NZ Herald News |publisher=Nzherald.co.nz |date=2011-10-15 |accessdate=2014-02-18}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/sport/football/2011/06/201161817443610159.html |title=Iraq elect new football head - Football |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date= |accessdate=2014-02-18}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wsc.co.uk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=2488&Itemid=29 |title=When Saturday Comes - War games |publisher=Wsc.co.uk |date=2012-07-09 |accessdate=2014-02-18}}{{cite web|author=Suzanne Goldenberg |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/jul/23/iraq.suzannegoldenberg |title=Uday: career of rape, torture and murder | World news |publisher=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=2014-02-18}}{{cite web|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/si_online/news/2003/03/24/son_of_saddam/ |title=SI.com - Sports Illustrated - The Magazine - From Sports Illustrated: Son of Saddam - Monday March 24, 2003 05:00 PM |publisher=Sportsillustrated.cnn.com |date=2003-03-24 |accessdate=2014-02-18}} The Iraqi Football Association was founded in 1948 and has been a member of [[FIFA]] since 1950, the [[Asian Football Confederation]] since 1970, and the Sub-confederation regional body [[West Asian Football Federation]] since 2000. Iraq also is part of the [[Union of Arab Football Associations]] and has been a member since 1974. The Iraqi team is commonly known as ''Usood Al-Rafidain'' ({{lang-ar|أسود الرافدين}}), which literally meaning ''Lions of [[Mesopotamia]]''. ==Association Founded== The Iraqi Football Association (Ittihad Al-Iraqi Le-Korat Al-Kadem) was formed on October 8, 1948 and was the third sports union to be founded in Iraq after the Track and Field Athletics and the Basketball Federations. The two unions took part at the 1948 Olympic Games in London, July 29 – August 14 – however the Iraqi FA had not been founded, so no football team took part in the Olympics. It was during the Olympics that the idea of an Iraq Football Association was put forward. During the 1948 London Olympic Games, Iraq's basketball team lost every game by an average of 104 points per game. They scored an average of 23.5 points per game. The team included Iraq’s first ever-national football captain Wadud Khalil and another member of Iraq’s first ever-national squad in 1951, the outside right Salih Faraj.{{cite web|last1=Mubarak|first1=Hassanin|title=Iraqi Football History|url=https://iraqsport.wordpress.com/2013/03/21/iraqi-football-history//}} ==First Administration== The first Iraqi FA administration was headed by President Obaid Abdullah Al-Mudhayfi and Saadi Jassim as general secretary, with its headquarters in the Sheikh Omar district in Baghdad. The IFA was an association of 14 teams from all over Iraq, they included the Royal Olympic Club (‘Nadi Al-Malikiya Al-Olympiya’), Royal Guards (‘Haris Al-Maliki’), Royal Air Force (‘Al-Quwa Al-Jawiya Al-Malikiya’), Police College (‘Kuliya Al-Shurta’), Kuliya Al-Askariya (‘Military College’), Dar Al-Mualameen Alaliya (‘Highest Teacher’s House’), Casual’s Club, Al-Marouf Al-Tarbiya (‘Physical Education’), Kuliya Al-Hakok (‘College of Law’), Quwa Al-Siyara (‘Armoured Cars’) from the capital Baghdad and four other teams [[Al-Minaa|Nadi Al-Minaa Al-Basri]] (Basra Port Club), Sharakat Al-Naft Al-Basra (Basra Petroleum Company) from Basra and branches in the provinces of [[Mosul]] and [[Kirkuk]]. {{wikinews|Iraq threatened with expulsion from world football by FIFA}} ==Controversies== {{see also|Age fraud in association football}} The Iraqi youth national teams have been ejected from tournaments for fielding over-age players.https://www.football.com/en-gb/massive-age-fraud-in-the-iraqi-youth-team/ In 1989, Iraq was banned for using over-age players in the under-20 world championships in Saudi Arabia. That ban was extended when [[Invasion of Kuwait|Iraq invaded Kuwait]] in August 1990.https://www.nytimes.com/1993/10/16/sports/soccer-iraqi-soccer-team-takes-its-first-shot-at-a-big-target-and-misses.html ==Association information== {| class="wikitable" style="width:30%;" |- ! Position ! Name |- |[[President]] |[[Abdul Khaliq Masood]] |} ==List of Presidents of IFA== The following is a '''list of [[president]]s of Iraq Football Association (IFA)'''. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Presidency ! President ! Took office ! Left office |- | 1 | Abdullah Al-Muthaifi | 1948 | 1952 |- | 2 | Akram Fahmi | 1953 | 1954 |- | 3 | Saadi Hussein Al-Douri | 1954 | 1955 |- | 4 | Ismail Mohammed | 1955 | 1956 |- | 5 | Hadi Abbas | 1956 | 1959 |- | 6 | Adeeb Najeeb | 1959 | 1961 |- | 7 | Adil Al-Basheer | 1961 | 1964 |- | 8 | Fahad Juwad Al-Meera | 1964 | 1968 |- | – | | 1968 | 1976 |- | 9 | Moayad Al-Badri | 1976 | 1977 |- | 10 | Hisham Atta Ajjaj | 1977 | 1980 |- | 11 | Soryan Tawfeeq | 1980 | 1984 |- | 12 | Sabah Mirza Mahmoud | 1984 | 1985 |- | 13 | [[Uday Hussein]] | 1985 | 1988 |- | 14 | Kareem Mahmoud Mulla | 1988 | 1990 |- | 15 | [[Uday Hussein]] | 1990 | 2003 |- | 16 | [[Hussein Saeed]] | 2004 | 2011 |- | 17 | [[Najeh Humoud]] | 2011 | 2014 |- | 18 | [[Abdul Khaliq Masood]] | 2014 | |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.ifa.iq Official site] {{ar icon}} *[https://www.fifa.com/associations/association=irq/index.html FIFA website] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20130403025457/http://www.the-afc.com/en/member-associations/west/iraqi-football-assoc.html Iraq] at AFC site {{Sports governing bodies in Iraq}} {{Football in Iraq}} {{Asia in topic|Football in}} {{International football}} {{AFC associations}} [[Category:Football in Iraq]] [[Category:Sports governing bodies in Iraq|Football]] [[Category:Asian Football Confederation member associations]] [[Category:Sports organisations established in 1948]] [[Category:1948 establishments in Iraq]] {{Iraq-sport-stub}} {{Footy-org-stub}}

{{Infobox horseraces | class = Domestic Grade I (JpnⅠ) | horse race = Japan Breeding farms' Cup Classic | image = [[File:JBC 2005.JPG|200px]] | caption = JBC Classic 2005 | location = Changes yearly | inaugurated = 2001 | race type = [[Thoroughbred]] [[Flat racing]] | website = | distance = Changes yearly | surface = Dirt | track = | qualification = 3-y-o & Up | weight = 3-y-o horses & geldings 55kg/fillies 53kg
4-y-o & up horses & geldings 57kg / mares 55 kg | purse = ¥136,000,000 (2011 Running) | bonuses = }} '''Japan Breeding farms' Cup Classic''' (ジャパンブリーディングファームズカップクラシック) is an annual race that is usually held on November 3, the national holiday [[Culture Day]]. This race and the [[Japan Breeding farm's Cup Sprint|JBC sprint]] were started in 2001, following American the [[Breeders' Cup]], though the JBC has only two category race. In 2011, JBC Lady’s Classic was added for fillies and mares. The track is changed yearly like the American [[Breeders' Cup]], so that the distances may differ. The distance was 2,000 meters from 2001 to 2004, in 2007 and 2011; 1,900 meters in 2005 and 2009; 2,100 meters in 2006; 1,870 meters in 2008; and 1800 meters in 2010. In both 2012 and the following year, it will be 2,100 meters. This is the highest-prized race in [[National Association of Racing]] (NAR), and the third highest-prized dirt event in Japan, following [[Champions Cup_(horse_race)|Champions Cup]] and [[February Stakes]] both organized by [[Japan Racing Association]](JRA). Until 2011, the winner’s prize was one hundred million yen. Although its prize money is high, this race is regarded as preparation for Champions Cup. Until year 2017, all winners were come from the JRA instead of organizer NAR. == Winners== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! style="background-color:#DACAA5; width:36px" | Year

The club placed 5th in 1992–93 season, and 4th out of 12 teams in 1993–94 season.[https://web.archive.org/web/20080605191833/http://nsl.kosarka.co.yu/History4.aspx YUBA League History] ==Coaches== {{main|Category:KK Profikolor coaches}} ==Notable players== {{main|Category:KK Profikolor players}} * {{flagicon|SCG}} [[Milenko Topić]] (1991–1995) * {{flagicon|SCG}} [[Dragiša Šarić]] (1992–1993) * {{flagicon|SCG}} [[Nikola Bulatović]] (1993–1994) * {{flagicon|SCG}} [[Dejan Radonjić]] (1993–1994) * {{flagicon|SCG}} [[Milan Preković]] (1992–1994) * {{flagicon|SCG}} [[Ivica Mavrenski]] (1992–1993) == See also == * [[KK Tamiš]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{YUBA League}} {{Men's Basketball Teams in Serbia}} {{Europe-basketball-team-stub}} {{Serbia-sport-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Profikolor}} [[Category:Defunct basketball teams in Serbia]] [[Category:Basketball teams in Yugoslavia]] [[Category:Basketball teams in Vojvodina]] [[Category:Pančevo]]

[[File:8kg_kettlebell.jpg|thumb|An 8kg kettlebell]] Kettlebell swing (AKA ''Russian swing, double-arm swing, or conventional kettlebell swing'') is a basic ballistic exercise used to train the [[posterior chain]] in a manner similar to broad jumping. It involves moving the bell in a pendulum motion from between the knees to anywhere between eye level to fully overhead<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.t-nation.com/training/kettlebell-swings-youre-doing-them-wrong|title=Kettlebell Swings: You're Doing Them Wrong {{!}} T Nation|last=Nation|first=Kelli Keyes, Abby Keyes, T|website=T NATION|language=en|access-date=2018-09-01}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://greatist.com/move/how-to-do-the-perfect-kettlebell-swing|title=How to Do the Perfect Kettlebell Swing|date=2017-07-10|work=Greatist|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theboxmag.com/crossfit-training/kettlebell-swing-10000|title=How To Do The Kettlebell Swing|work=The Box|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en-us}}</ref> and can be performed either two-handed or using one hand.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.livestrong.com/article/140173-benefits-kettlebell-swings/|title=Benefits of Kettlebell Swings|last=Dale|first=Patrick|work=LIVESTRONG.COM|access-date=2018-08-27|language=en-US}}</ref> There are three versions of kettlebell swing: Russian Swing, American Swing and Sport Style Swing.
== Overview == [[File:Kettlebell Swing Hip Hinge Style.webm|thumb|Kettlebell swing - Hinge-based style]] The kettlebell is swung from just below the groin to somewhere between the upper abdomen and shoulders, with arms straight or slightly bent, the degree of flexion depends on the trajectory of the kettlebell. The key to a good kettlebell swing is effectively thrusting the hips, not bending too much at the knees and sending the weight forwards, as opposed to squatting the weight up, or lifting up with the arms. This requires an intense contraction of the [[Gluteal muscles|gluteal]], [[Abdomen#muscles|abdominal]] and [[Latissimus dorsi muscle|latissimus]] muscles. The swing can also be performed with a release and catch of the kettlebell, which helps train the proper swing pattern where the arms aren't pulling up at the top. This can be done with two hands switching to a supinated catch. The one-arm swing presents a significant anti-twisting challenge, and can be used with an alternating catch switching between arms. Further variations include the walking swing taking a step forward at the apex of each swing, the outside swing where the kettlebell swings outside the leg, and the kneeling swing, swinging between the legs in a one-leg half-kneeling position. {{cn|date=September 2018}}
There is controversy within the kettlebell world about whether a swing can only be performed with a hip hinge, and not with a squat. Within the kettlebell sport world, employing knee flexion during the swing is more common. == Types and variations == There are two types of kettlebell swings:
* Hardstyle kettlebell swing (Hinge-based) – a hinge pattern which primarily utilizes the muscles of the posterior chain (hamstrings and glutes). It should be practised with a good ground connection for stability and power production; a flat sole shoe or barefoot is preferred when performing swings.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.menshealth.com/fitness/a19528502/kettlebell-swing/|title=The Right Way to Do a Kettlebell Swing|date=2016-09-12|work=Men's Health|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.kettlebellkings.com/blog/kettlebell-foundations-the-hardstyle-kettlebell-swing/|title=Kettlebell Foundations: The Hardstyle Kettlebell Swing|work=Kettlebell Kings|access-date=2018-09-08|language=en}}</ref>
* Kettlebell sport swing (Pendulum-based) – the motion of the kettlebell sport swing is double knee bend compared to the focused hip hinging motion of the hardstyle swing. This allows for stretch reflex from hamstrings to help scoop the bell up, ensures upward trajectory.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.kettlebellkings.com/blog/intro-to-kettlebell-sport-part-2-the-kettlebell-sport-swing/|title=Intro To Kettlebell Sport Part 2: The Kettlebell Sport Swing|work=Kettlebell Kings|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en}}</ref>
There are many variations of the kettlebell swing<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.living.fit/p/kettlebell-swing-variations|title=Kettlebell Swing Variations|website=www.living.fit|language=en|access-date=2018-09-01}}</ref>, some are, but not limited to:
* single arm swing * one kettlebell double arm swing * two kettlebells double arm swing * suitcase swing * swing squat style * high swing
Within those variations there are plenty more variations, some are, but not limited to:
* pace * movement * speed * power * grip * direction of thumb * elbow flexion * knee flexion
== Benefits == Kettlebell swing benefits include<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://breakingmuscle.com/fitness/the-kettlebell-swing-why-its-the-perfect-exercise|title=The Kettlebell Swing: Why It's the Perfect Exercise|work=Breaking Muscle|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en}}</ref>:
* Increased Power<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bodybuilding.com/content/kettlebell-explosion-harness-the-power-of-the-kettlebell-swing.html|title=Kettlebell Explosion: Harness The Power Of The Kettlebell Swing|date=2013-11-19|work=Bodybuilding.com|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en-US}}</ref> * Increased Muscular Endurance<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.mensjournal.com/health-fitness/perfect-kettlebell-swing/|title=The Perfect Kettlebell Swing|date=2014-01-07|work=Men's Journal|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en-US}}</ref> * Increased Aerobic Capacity * Increased Anaerobic Capacity
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Exercise physiology]]

[[Image:Popularity of Tennis in the 17th century.jpg|thumb|upright=1.35|right|Longue Paume in the 17th century.]] [[File:Coubertin - Une campagne de vingt-et-un ans, 1909 (page 46 crop).jpg|350px|thumb|Competition of longue paume in the Garden of the Luxembourg (Paris), on June 18th, 1889]] '''Longue paume''', or ''jeu de longue paume'', is an outdoor version of [[jeu de paume]], an ancestor of modern [[tennis|lawn tennis]]. Hundreds of years ago it was quite popular, particularly in [[France]]. It is a game of gain-ground as [[Balle à la main]]
It was part of the Paris [[1900 Summer Olympics]], but its medal status is disputed. Today, the sport is most played in the region of [[Picardy]]. The governing body of the sport is the ''Fédération Française de Longue Paume'', with its headquarters in [[Amiens]].
== Others games of gain-ground == * [[Ballon au poing]] * [[Balle à la main]] * [[Real tennis]] * Balle pelote * Balle au tamis * [[Llargues]]
== See also == {{Commons category|Longue paume}} * [[Handball International Championships]] * [[International game]]
==External links== *{{cite web |url=http://www.longue-paume.fr/lp/ |title=Fédération Française de Longue Paume |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160527050336/http://www.longue-paume.fr/lp/ |archivedate=May 27, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }} * [http://perso.wanadoo.fr/jf.tricoire/Longue_Paume/EPS-LPpremiere.htm Connaissez-vous la Longue Paume?]
[[Category:Longue paume| ]] [[Category:Games of gain-ground]] [[Category:Ball games]] [[Category:Team sports]] [[Category:Former Summer Olympic sports]] [[Category:Forms of tennis]] [[Category:Sports originating in France]]
